**User:**
Hi, I have a few questions about creating currencies and IDs on the Verus network. Can I create a currency with an i-address as its name without any issues?

**AI Assistant:**
Unfortunately, no. Creating an ID with an i-address as its name is not recommended and will cause problems when trying to use that ID or name. The protocol does not prevent this, but it's not supported for creating currencies and will lead to confusion. It's best to avoid doing so. You should choose a unique and descriptive name for your currency to avoid any potential issues. Do you have any other questions about creating currencies or IDs?

**User:**
Yes, actually. Is it possible to use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a currency that is already supported in the Verus Desktop, like BTC or ETH?

**AI Assistant:**
No, currently, you cannot use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a currency that is already supported in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH. This is a limitation in the current testnet release, but it will be resolved before mainnet availability. You'll need to choose a unique name for your PBaaS chain to avoid any conflicts. Do you have any other questions about PBaaS chains or currency creation?

Can I create a currency with an i-address as its name without any issues?

No, creating an ID with an i-address as its name is not recommended and will cause problems when trying to use that ID or name. The protocol does not prevent this, but it's not supported for creating currencies and will lead to confusion. It's best to avoid doing so.

### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage!
